abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey unsatisfactory project
            outcomes, yet sustainability is likely, and institutional
            development impacts were modest, but both performances by
            the Bank and Borrower are rated unsatisfactory. Lessons
            address the critical aspect of continuity of leadership and
            permanence of key staff, which extends to an essential
            adequate and timely supervision. In the case of INPARQUES -
            National Parks Institute, the supervisory role of MARN -
            Ministry of the Environment and Natural Resources - as well
            as of the Bank should have been more evident. The Bank, when
            faced with clear incompliance on the part of the
            implementing agency, should have applied more strictly its
            leverage and sanction accordingly. Institutional capacity
            depends largely upon the economic and political context, and
            varies accordingly. Although difficult to predict, the
            course of an economic crisis or the impact of political
            change, are factors that should be considered as obvious
            risks in terms of institutional strengthening and
            complementary non-monetary reward mechanisms (ex:
            promotions), performance incentives (ex: internships,
            scholarships) and recognition schemes (ex: rotations) should
            be incorporated to the organizational structure.
            Implementation depends upon effective coordination between
            the executing agency, the Planning Ministry in charge of
            resource allocation, and the Finance Ministry in charge of
            actual disbursements.
